security: The text is redacted because the public disclosure of the redaction could reasonably be expected to constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, and that invasion of privacy would be so substantial that it outweighs the public interest.
summary: This document is a notification from the Assassination Records Review Board regarding the postponed release of certain information within HSCA staff payroll records, specifically Social Security Numbers, due to privacy concerns, with a future review date set for 2017.
summary_one_paragraph: The Assassination Records Review Board issued a Final Determination Notification on December 8, 1995, regarding HSCA staff payroll records. The Board postponed the release of Social Security numbers contained within the records, citing concerns over unwarranted invasion of personal privacy that would outweigh public interest. The document includes payroll authorization forms and personal leave records for Ralph C. Locke, documenting his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations from November 1976 through July 1978, and the next review of the postponed information was scheduled for 2017.
title: Final Determination Notification: HSCA Staff Payroll Records
recipient: Clerk of the House of Representatives
